turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: Have we reached the epi-center?

turns.speaker: ADONIS
turns.text: Ayy!  Some cat's blocking the periscope.  Somebody, give it a swat...

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: Works for me.

turns.speaker: ADONIS
turns.text: I don't know about you, guys, but I'm getting a little buzz off this.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: I'm not going to worry about it. We are quite beyond the computer disc. Everything will be over within the next hour or so.

turns.speaker: ADONIS
turns.text: Yew'll be ovah in the naxt tehn minutes...

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: Adonis, be polite. She's a friend.

turns.speaker: ADONIS
turns.text: Cactus, I can't believe you just said all that...

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: Oops--my face must match my cape. And to think we were going to let you go...

turns.speaker: ADONIS
turns.text: I thought we were going to take it easy until the Mission...

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: This looks promising...

turns.speaker: ADONIS
turns.text: Ah, Cats. Now and Forever.

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: Be verwy, verwy, quiet; I'm hunting Catwomen.

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: That's a good one, dude. He says we're going to kill you whether you tell us where the disc is or not.

turns.speaker: ADONIS
turns.text: You know, nobody likes you...

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: Yeah, all those women who went feline this afternoon...They're so ashamed now..

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: He likes you. Kincaid and I have always had similar tastes...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: In women?

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: No, in art. I try not bring up women around Kincaid. It's a sore spot between us. Long story..

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I'll bet. Funny, for some reason, I don't think dogs are supposed to like me.

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: You say that like an amnesia victim.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Guilty. I am.

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Ouch. I hope you're not offended by aggressively curious men.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I don't know. I can't remember.

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Strange--you seemed so close. I wonder what's happened since yesterday..

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I wonder..

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: What's the matter...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Nothing, just a jolt of deja-vu. I think I went out with a guy with a dignified British butler--can't remember how it turned out..

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: I'll bet the butler's name wasn't "Jeff."

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: You're probably right.

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: I was wondering, if you're not doing anything tonight...Would you like to go to dinner? I know; a tame suggestion considering the wide variety of miniature golf possibilities available to the Oasisburg citizen--but nevertheless, would you?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: How heroic of you...

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Kincaid got a little frisky last night...So, meet here at eight and go from there?  By the way, I'm Brock Leviathan.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: But of course you are. Dinner at Eight.  Wouldn't miss it.

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: There's a nice cafe down the street...unless you're afraid of this Catwoman prowling around. We can always dine at the mansion, if..

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I'm not afraid. Are you?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: You designed Gotham Plaza?  The big silver guys pulling on those big silver things...

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: What did you think?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Oh, it's superb--I mean if you like that fascist nightmare kind of thing...

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Hey, hey, the client comes first. You think I want my future children to know their Daddy created Frank's Fun Palace?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I checked out your stuff at the library.  Awesome work, really. Why would someone like you want to go out with a...with a..what exactly am I, again?

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: You're very special. Selina, I'm not a very good liar. I feel very strongly about you...forgive me use of architecture metaphors, but I instantly know a good foundation when I see one..

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: I despise these kind of winds. Sorry, I guess I'm a little on edge. Seems this Catwoman has everyone, men and women, on edge. Don't you feel Catwoman says something about the duality of all men and women...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Stop. We are not having a "duality" conversation. "Ooh, he has a secret side.  Ooh, she has a dark side." Please.  Duality is a joke. You get one, do you understand me?  You get one life. One shot. I'm so tired of women saying "I have an inner strength" or "Deep down, I'm really ambitious." "One day I'll design my own line of clothing and write children's stories, if I can only remember to return the videos I rented last night." If you are something, then you better be out there doing something.  You need to be the same bold thing in the day that you are at night--with maybe a slight clothing change. There is no gray area. The truth is not somewhere in between. There are two sides to every personality, all right--the reality...and the lie. We are not having a "duality" conversation.

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: So, did you see "Seinfeld" last week? That Kramer-guy really makes me laugh.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I'm sorry I went off like that, I get passionate. I--I guess I'm a passionate person. One of those things I had forgotten.  When you were a little boy did you want to grow up to be a superhero?

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: What little boy doesn't...  My God...it's, it's...Catwoman.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: No it's not.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: A whip?  Now that's going too far!  Some of these women have no shame!

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: What's the matter?  What are you saying?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Well, it's just that I would think that the woman who is the real, non- imitation Catwoman would be pretty angry at some little amateur minx stealing the whole whip idea. Really angry.

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: This is insane. Let the heroes handle it.  I'd better get you home...I should check on my warehouse to make sure it hasn't been hit...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Your warehouse?  Go on ahead--to your "warehouse." I'll be okay...

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I'm sure.

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Selina, did you make it home, all right?  I tried calling, but your mother said that there was "no extension in the Hut." Whatever that means..

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I got home fine. How's the "warehouse."

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Fine. You're angry. Don't be. The important thing is we're together now..

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: At some sanctimonious celebration of condescension. Nothing like appeasing half the population with a two hour luncheon.

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Exactly. I don't know what I'd do without you.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Uh Brock, today you are without me...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Tonight, somewhere in the city, innocent people will die--but then one of you knows that; for one of you is a vicious pirate-terrorist posing as the beloved superhero Captain God.

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: What did you say?  Selina, sit down, the entire city is going crazy...You have to just calm down...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Hmm. Not bad.

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: You're telling the truth. I can tell..How did this..

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: No-o. You know, questions like that don't help your cause--

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: I still can't get over it. I still can't believe you're Catwoman..

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Quite a pair we make. Thank you, Jeff.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: A couple that battles the forces of evil together is a couple that stays together.  Thank you, Jeff.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Oh now, you put up a good fight. Let's change the subject. Where do people who live in Oasisburg go to get away from it all?

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Somewhere very far away, very quiet, and very...  This is all wonderful, Selina, but...But I'm afraid I can not rest until all my sister's killers are brought to justice...That one-armed monster..

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: This ring belonged to my sister. I'd love for you to...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: It would be honor, Brock. Now let's go get this guy...

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: You're serious?  You'd help me...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: In many ways, that obnoxious creep Cactus was the worst one of all. He got off on giving out pain...

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: We'll hunt him down together...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I thought you said you weren't a very good liar.

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: I lied.

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: There you are darling...Have we met, Lewis Lane, Oasisburg Times.

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Oh, how long have you had your own route?

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: Can I just say what a classy touch the neon urinals are, Mr. Architect?  I just love risking electrocution every time I..

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: Women, huh?

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: They do take their time. So..Selina Kyle...

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: Selina Kyle...lovely person.

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: She has a real spirit.

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: A bit on the suspicious side, don't you think?

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: She has reason to be suspicious..Doesn't she?

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: I suppose she does.

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: I better go report this in...

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Oh, you don't have to explain to me where you're going...

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: Selina, are you okay?

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Yes, did you call us here for any particular reason?

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: You're kidding.

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: But it's true!  You can call him yourself.

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: You're right, I wasn't looking to fall in love with a casino worker. I'd given up trying to find anyone. But there was a fire in your eyes that cut right through the air conditioning and through the coldness of my heart.

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: Your uniform, that first time I saw you, was a ghastly cage I vowed to unlock in order to..

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: We're waiting.

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Quiet, Blender Boy. I told you from the beginning, Selina, I'm not a very good liar. I am not Captain God, or whatever else he may be calling himself this month, but when I find out who is--The Man will pay.  My sister died in that Museum attack. You can check the Atlanta obituaries. I've tracked these monsters from city to city, waiting for a time to exact my revenge. Why else would I come to Oasisburg and create the most obnoxious casino in the world?

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: Did you ever think that maybe neither of us is Captain God?

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: I can. That's not an admission of guilt,  It's just..I knew you had it in you...

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: It may be time to get the police involved...

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: I've been looking for you.

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: I've been looking for you.  Selina Kyle was right. One of us is a psychotic crusader.

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: But then we knew that all along, didn't we...

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: I guess we did. When you were a little boy, did you want to be a superhero?

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: What little boy doesn't?

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: You've lost all motor functions. The poison will kill you in ten minutes.

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: Hey, speaking of Wrong Place, Wrong Time.  Lewis Lane to the rescue!

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Priceless...We have a showdown in this alley, right?

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Don't you feel so much better now that you know everything?  Blink once for yes, twice for..

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: Boss, we better roll if we're going to hit this place, blow it up, and make that flight..

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Just hold on!  I'm not done. There are two kinds of men in the world, Selina. In Category A, you have Me. In Category B is everyone who wants to be in Category A, but are too afraid, too weak..!

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: God, can you hear me!

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Wha-at?

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: Catwomen. Lots of them!

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Oh come on, Cactus, be a man!  The blimp is still on schedule, right?

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: I thought cats were supposed to have nine lives, not thirty one!  What do you think you're doing?

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: Winning.

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: What do you want from me?

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: At this point, a nap. Oh by the way, I killed your butler and your dog..

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: My dog!

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: Oh Honey, it's so much better when we do it without the helmet.

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: I've been thinking. I've been thinking about us. I'm sorry I've been so hard no you these past couple days. I realize now it's because you're the only woman who ever understood me and I couldn't handle it!  I've never revealed myself to anyone the way I have to you. Let's blow this town together.  We'll run a bed-and-breakfast in Vermont by day, and by night, we'll dress up and kill anything that...

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: Pass!

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: You were right all along--the two parts to a person are the reality and the lie.  I was making good money as a top architect--but that's not who I am. I'm not an architect, I'm a..

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: I know, I know, a Warrior. You're very annoying..Now tell me how to defuse the bomb you've set..

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Will you please stop fighting?  Just let those people die so we can get on with our new lives together!  Trust me, one day we'll look back on this day and laugh. You got to admit, it's a lot more fun to be the villain.

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: You might be right, but Fun is overrated.  I need something real.

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Well then, let's agree to disagree...Now how about a picture for my scrapbook?

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: Don't you realize there's nothing you can do, anyway!  Nine minutes and it's all over!  The Fun Palace is a tomb. No one can get out. And choke on this furball: all doors and windows are blocked, locked, and electrified!  Even the glass around the bomb is rigged.

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: Even the skylight?

turns.speaker: BROCK
turns.text: The "skylight?" Fool!  It's too high for anybody to climb out the damn skylight...

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: What about "climbing in?"

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: The shopkeeper on 13th street won't drop the lawsuit--He still claims one of the lasers we fired at the Jenkins gang burned down his store..

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: I hate innocent bystanders.  Whine, whine, whine. Will he settle?

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: "Dat's gotta hurt!"

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: He didn't remember to roll up his window...

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: What's the catch?

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: Ooh, I've read about this philly. She's the one who gave that wimp Batman all those migraines up in Gotham...

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: Not now, Mammoth. Adonis is right. We've had a good run here--the protection kickbacks from the crime syndicates, the merchandising scams-- Tomorrow night we have a big, violent, complicated and lucrative mission to pull off. We chould be resting up.

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: Resting Up?  Sorry Spooky, I've got to go with God on this one. I hate to think we're just in this for the money.  Garfield's girlfriend crossed a line last night and she's got to get spayed. We're going out of Oasisburg on a win.

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: Yeah, this is better than rape.

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: Cactus, sometimes you don't deserve to wear our logo.

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: Touchy. Look everybody, it's Casper, the friendly crimefighter...

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: What a "drag."

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: "Well done," Cactus.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: Cactus--shooting a man in the back is not very noble.

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: That is not a man, Captain God. That is Vomit accidentally born with two legs.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: Well. I stand corrected.

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: Boss-man, what were you going on about last night: "I am the Law and I am the Danish..."

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: I don't know what I was saying. I totally phoned it in last night. I haven't been getting a lot of sleep lately...

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: Right time. That was kind of fun. She had spunk.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: Why am I still troubled...

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: I don't know, Boss, you saw what the big guy did to the last kitty we gave him.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: How could I forget. Mammoth--go pet the kitty.

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: God-damn..

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: What did you say?

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: Sorry man, I didn't mean that personally...

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: I know how you feel, humiliated in the hands of a woman. I'd rather eat my soul on a paper plate...

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: Ah, did you hear that?  Spooky loved you...

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: Yeah...pretty gross. Hurry, we've got work to do.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: Quite a little performance you gave in the casino today--for me and that other guy. Come on down, let's chat..

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: I got her...

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: Car wash, Captain?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: Absolutely.

turns.speaker: CACTUS
turns.text: My, the Perpetrator seems to be a bit on the "Wild" side..

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: I'll put that in the report--after you shoot her.

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: Oh, I wish they wouldn't feed him like that.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: Now he'll be up all night...

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: Well, we spent enough time building the damn thing, might as well use it.

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: A bit sadistic, don't you think, Captain...?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: Well, you don't see that everyday. Somebody tell me what's the deal with Frida Kahlo here?

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: Just a homeless woman. Wrong place.

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: You like them, don't you, Boss.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: Oh, I like her. I like her a lot. I want to save this one for later. Something that tasty you don't eat all at once. Go back to your alter- egos, we'll regroup in the morning.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: The Tranquilizer Tranquility will hold for about an hour..where is she? These women are out here on a lark-- Ladies Night at a discotheque.  It's not in their blood the way it is for Catwoman...Where is she?

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: I hate it when you get like this. This Catwoman is becoming an obsession. I say we call it a night. Tomorrow is a big day for us...

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: What's the matter with you, Spooky, my most trusted comrade?  We are warriors!  These are the challenges we live for!

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: I want out of tonight's mission. I can't do it anymore, Captain. I can't let innocent people die to prove our superiority..I can't.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: Just like a woman. You want out. You're out.

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: Why are you--I fought for you with honor.  Why should it matter if I'm a man or a woman, as long as I'm a good warrior.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: Of course it matters!  It throws off everything!  "Superhero" is manhood's highest achievement. Manhood!  Your dirty little secret has diseased us to the core. You were my buddy, my comrade-- women aren't buddies, women aren't warriors!  You tried to turn the Cult of Good into some after-work softball team!  It's time to get thrown from the treehouse...

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: I loved you.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: You're not a super-hero. You're not even a hero. You're a scary, sick, fake who made a big mistake. You killed someone very special to me..

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: And...your point?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: Hasn't anyone ever taught you that fighting violence with violence solves nothing.

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: It's a lot more fun than fighting violence with pamphlets. That voicebox of yours is a hoot. Say "I'm wearing no underwear"--it'll be funny..  You do know you're evil, don't you?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: A superhero's job is to protect society.  Don't blame me if society is a horrible, corrupt joke.

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: "A superhero's job is to protect.." Sorry, I can't take you seriously...I overheard you say that tomorrow the Cult of Good will be dead--I should be so lucky--what did that mean?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: My, those little ears pick up a lot. The Cult of Good will die heroically preventing a world-class heist. Since we will be the ones performing the heist, our deaths will obviously be fake. But have no fear. There will be many other deaths tomorrow...and those will be quite real. I'm afraid these questions of yours put you in a position not unlike a long-tailed tabby in room full of rocking chairs.

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: Oh please, sir, one more. Are you the reporter or the architect?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: Yes. I am the reporter or the architect.  You've been through so much..It looks like you've used up all nine of your lives...

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: I still have one left...

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: You think so?...Selina?

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: You've seen me...

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: How can you say things with such feeling and then turn around and put on a helmet and...Who are you?  Were you sitting on my right or my left at the card table?  Tell me!  Please tell me who you are; you own me that!

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: I know, I should probably tell you, but I just don't feel like it. To be honest, I'm really angry at you. I admired you so much more when you were purely wicked. I mean, look at you now, running around trying to "get to the bottom" of things. Trying to "save the city." It's true we're about to do a very nasty deed, but really, what's it to you?  Since when do you care what happens to a bunch of pathetic Oasiburgians? You're just not yourself, anymore.

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: I'm supposed to be taking personality tips from you three?  You people were once heroes. You had ideals.  You fought for things.  Spooky told me so...

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: Do you have any idea how much superheroes get paid?  Zilcho. Urban vigilantes with secret identities operating outside the law. Not exactly the stuff of a W-2 form.  If it wasn't for merchandising and corruption and these diabolical "missions"...There is no such thing as heroes and villains, anymore, Selina.  There are only winners and losers. You lost. We won.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN GOD
turns.text: Ah, the good guys always triumph in the end. It's what allows our children to sleep at night.

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: You can't get away with..

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: Spooky.

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: Spear.

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: Hello, Spooky.

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: I don't want to hurt you, Catwoman. Yet.  After tomorrow, you can do anything you want, but please, just stay out of sight for the next 24 hours. I won't stand by and watch my leader get all emotional over an animal like you. I warn you, don't tempt Captain God when he is angry. Let is complete our mission in peace.

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: Whatever you say...Sis.

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: Can't you understand--I got tired of being a woman. I wanted the respect that only a cape, boots, chestplate, and a mechanical spear can bring..

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: You're not strong. You're scared..scared that someone like me will see right through you. Whatever the Cult of Good was, it's not anymore... You don't have to listen to me, just listen to you..

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: I heard what you said, Spooky. I can't believe he shot you...

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: Men, huh?

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: For when the time comes..

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: For when the..Uh, yeah, thanks, a little gold piece of...gold. Uh...

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: And I...I..want you to know our secrets..

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: Oh no, not a computer disc. A computer disc?  Oh man, come on, what do I look like?  I'm not a crime- fighter, I'm not a detective, what, I'm supposed to find some "clues" on this disc. I can't...

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: The Mission is happening tonight..It's up to you to...to save the City...

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: "Save the City?" I don't want to save the city, I want to move!  Listen, I'm sure the computer disc is pretty fascinating and I can't thank you enough for the little weird gold thingie, but..

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: You know, my name's not Spooky. It's, it's Rachel.

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: Hello, Rachel. I'm Selina.

turns.speaker: FEMALE EXEC CAT
turns.text: You Housewives have no idea what we go through!

turns.speaker: HOUSECAT
turns.text: You Career girls have no idea what we go through.

turns.speaker: FEMALE EXEC CAT
turns.text: Did you just say "girls?"

turns.speaker: FEMALE EXEC CAT
turns.text: I'm a good mother!

turns.speaker: HOUSECAT
turns.text: You mean, "Consuela" is a good mother..

turns.speaker: FEMALE EXEC CAT
turns.text: How did you know our nanny's name is...Lucky guess!

turns.speaker: HOUSECAT
turns.text: What's the name of your child's best friend?

turns.speaker: FEMALE EXEC CAT
turns.text: Ask me another one--

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: You're late. I've got some good news and some good news. I'm giving you more hours and the new uniforms came in.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: What's the good news?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: You know, Kyle, you're still pretty hot for a pre-Bicentennial babe...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: "Pre-bicentennial babe?"

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Yeah, as in born before..Ooh, I suppose it's "sexual harassment" to give a woman a compliment. Sheesh. Come on, gentleman...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: There you are, Selina. I've been thinking..I have some.."positions" opening up..

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Stop.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Oh, what?  I offer you a job in implied exchange for physical favors and suddenly it's "sexual harassment..."

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Can I be frank, Frank?  Your entire existence is sexual harassment. I accept there's not much you can do about it.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Hey, you're anti-male.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Oh Frank, I'm not anti-male, I'm anti- you. Believe me, there's a difference.  Kelly is designing new uniforms for next week. Pay her and thank her. And is it a rule that the hottest places on the planet have the coldest air conditioning.  There's something out there called 73 degrees, look into it.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: What if I were to say "You're Fired?"

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: What if I were to say "Your Wife"-- as in does she know of your touching mentor-student relationship with the post-Bicentennial babe working the roulette wheel?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Kelly, get to work on those new uniforms.  I'm not running a summer camp here..

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: A genuine woman of mystery in Oasisburg.  Amnesia. Bulletholes in exposed stomach badly concealed with body make-up.  Beautiful, intelligent eyes that have no business in "Frank's Fun Palace" or anybody else's Fun Palace for that matter..

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Uh. "Thanks?"

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I don't know what came over me.

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: What is it with women and Catwoman? Men have the courtesy to punish the weak, but women love punishing the strong. Don't get me wrong--this Catwoman is a terrifying, subversive menace to everything this community stands for and she must be stopped. It's just, I like her a lot.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Yeah, she's okay.

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: Most articles focus on the first half of her name--describing some feline monster.  I want the woman of Catwoman. After all, if it was a man dressed as a cat, the story would be on page 23--just another loony. Oh, I want this one. I want her bad..

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: Sorry, I get carried away. Once I become interested in someone, I can't stop trying to figure them out...Amnesia victims are challenging..

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I actually got some memory back last night.

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Enough.

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: Oh now this one is mine...

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: Oh the hand--my grandfather is inventing a new kind of blender and..You know, I realize I've never officially introduced myself...I'm Lewis Lane.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: But of course you are.

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: I was wondering, if you're not doing anything tonight...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I am. Dinner with Brock Leviathan...

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: Ah!  Ah!--God no, don't tell me you're one of those women who are attracted to ruggedly handsome and brilliant architects..

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: Good morning.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Ah!  You scared me!  How did you know to come here!  Have you been spying..

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: No, of course not. You're listed. Not the hut, exactly, but the rest of..

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Well. I'd let you come in, but the place is a mess...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Next time, call...

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: I thought you'd like a ride to work.  You don't own a cat, do you?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Hey, Captain God!

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: What did--?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: You turned around!

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: Yes, you shouted the words "Captain God" at me for no reason...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Oh, do you turn around every time somebody just shouts at you?

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: Actually, yes.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Did you try to kill...

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Nothing. How's your hand?

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: About the same. Thanks for asking...Damn blender.  Okay, I can't stand it anymore, I'm dying to know--Did you try on some whiskers last night and hit a 7-11 along with all those other women? You had to have thought about it--a Catwoman for a night?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Like you don't know...

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: I'm having a hard time picking up your signal this morning--What did you say?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I said I saw you last night. What were you doing hiding in that alley, running off when the superhero alarm sounded...

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: I was doing my job. At the risk of sounding egotistical, I didn't become the best reporter in the world sitting by the phone. I was chasing tail all night--I was not spying, intentionally, on your hot and heavy date with "Brock Leviathan, architect."  I can't believe he ordered white wine.  You do know white wine is not real wine...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Hey, I thought...

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: I'm afraid last night was the last straw of our city's tourists. The Mayor, in his finite wisdom, is throwing a "Month of the Woman" luncheon ball for the public this afternoon to try and calm everyone down. I thought maybe you and I could...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Go together?  Sure, why not?  Another date with someone who could be an insane messenger of death for all I know. No offense. Hey, lean over, let me smell your breath..Say in a deep voice, "A superhero's job is to protect..."

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: You're scaring me, Selina.  Do it some more.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I give up. I give up.--I can't figure you out. Not gonna try.

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: You can't figure me out. You're the strange one..

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: You are...

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: Uh-huh..

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: Hey, architect--she's joking. Right, Selina?  Selina?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I'm not through. This will come as a shock. Again, to one of you. I am Catwoman. The Catwoman.

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: Some reporter I am..all this time my story is right there in front..I have a lot of questions.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Fine, fine, at a later date, I'll be more than happy to talk about my perverse psychological complexities with the one who's not the creep. But for now, I'm drilling inside your brains...I bring up the whole Catwoman thing for one reason.  I bit Captain God in the hand and the next day you both show up equipped with big bandaids and wobbly excuses--  "My grandfather is inventing a new kind of blender.."

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Lose the smile, Mr. Good Reflexes. We were having a pretty okay time the other night--good food, good conversation--some Catwomen show up and it's "You need cab fare?; I got to go to my Hideout--Oh, I'm sorry, I mean "warehouse."

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: Not too cool...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Then there's you, Louis, sneaking through back alleys and surprise visiting me at my home..Both of you have been way too frisky from the get- go. I'm actually a pretty amazing person--funny, smart, attractive when I get my sleep--but you two had no way of knowing that-- when I met you both I was basically a morose, depressed amnesiac incapable of any human feeling. The only reason one of you wanted to go out with me is because you knew I was Catwoman.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: You know, now that I hear myself tell it, I'm thinking maybe both of you are messing with me. What, you get the Helmet Monday through Thursday, then Brock takes it for the weekend...

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: Okay. Let's get serious. Of course I know the Cult of Good is not good. Ever since I saw what they did in Atlanta, it has been my mission to expose them. I've followed them to Oasisburg and soon will have enough hard evidence to bring them to real justice. That computer disc could be the final piece to the puzzle. This isn't just a story, Selina--another damn Pulitzer--this is my life.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Have you seen the Oasisburg Police? They drive golf carts with little red sirens.

turns.speaker: LANE
turns.text: We have to do something. What can we do to help, Selina?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I'll let you know.

turns.speaker: LIBRARY CLERK
turns.text: I'm sorry, ma'am, there are no pets allowed in the library...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: But I'm blind.

turns.speaker: LIBRARY CLERK
turns.text: It's seeing-eye dogs, ma'am. If I let the cat stay, will you go out with me?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: What if I say I'll go out with you, so you can have all these great daydreams, but then never actually talk to you again?

turns.speaker: LIBRARY CLERK
turns.text: Okay, deal.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: "I'll go out with you." Now go get me these old newspapers...

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: You're late.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Yes, Mother. Dear.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: A hearty breakfast is the start of a great morning...

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Oh, I forgot to tell you, you're on a diet...The fact you're still reasonably pretty is the one thing you got going for you.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Oh Mommy, you're embarrassing me.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Is every single thing out of your mouth since your "accident" have to be a monotone mumble of cheap sarcasm?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: It's funny, I've heard of giving up finding a man and raising a family to pursue a career. And I've heard of foregoing a career to start a family-- but I think you're onto something new, Selina. "Absolutely nothing"-- Has a ring to it. I think it could catch on...How's that for sarcasm?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Pretty good...Mom, I don't want you to think I don't appreciate...letting me stay, getting me the job--I've been a mess. I'm still a mess. It's just...we have to start having a different conversation. I can't take..
